ratings.comment: pros: knowledge depth, careful and detailed teaching. Cons: you may fail! For me, these are the most helpful classes ever.

Brilliant Professor, incredibly rigorous yet fulfilling classes. A class with Drugan is a class you want to approach as different than a typical college class, he covers very complicated material in sufficient depth and then gives very rigorous homework, exams, and design projects. If you want to advance as an engineer take a class with him.

Prof. Drugan is harsh, unforgiving and assigns a massive homework load.  HOWEVER he is without a doubt the finest instructor I've ever had.  I've never before encountered an educator capable of explaining such complex concepts with such clarity.  If you want a friend, find someone else.  If you want to learn some Engineering, go with Drugan.

I really like the way he manages his classes. You will be in big trouble if you are not really paying attention in class. Homework is sometimes pretty difficult and time consuming, but that is the way you can learn stuff.

one of the worst, if not the worst, ever instructor who ever existed. I have no idea how any school would even have such a person working for them. Forget getting any help or any response from him. You are on your own. A terrible so called teacher. Avoid at any cost.
Going to office hours are a waste of time as he WILL NOT help you. His lectures are clear and organized.  Unfortunately, a lot of the material is from the (terrible) book and not covered in class.

Ask anyone about this guy.  Their face will melt and their stomachs turn.  The material was fascinating.  Asking the prof. for help without pretty much having the answer is a waste of time.  His lectures are clear, but this doesn't much help for the homework.  Avoid at all costs.  This class is perhaps the most difficult and you're on your own.

He is a smart person(I assume so since he graduated from Ivy League)and he expects the student to think critically like he did. It's a pain but it's not impossible. For midterm, we still have 90+ students. The material itself is hard and it's a crucial stuff, you have to understand it thoroughly or you could cause a bridge to collapse etc

worst professor i have had. homework averages always about 50%. the homework is from the book which sucks, he doesn't teach in any manner that the book does so his lectures don't help with homework. and the tests are just as hard. also is no help on homework if you go into office hours

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Would talk down to students as if we should be experts on the material after 1 lecture. Tests are hard, lectures aren't much help yet mandatory, enough homework, and design projects. 5 credits of work for a 3 credit class. Take ME 306 if possible, or at least not him.

No help at office hours.  Just says "I want you to figure it out."  Writes about 10 pages of notes on the board for you to copy so you can never pay attention to what he is saying.  Homework is ridiculous and takes up all of your time.  Exams are even harder. I found out from people a couple of weeks into the semester that you should never take him

Gives you 7 credits worth of work for a 3 credit class. Exams are near impossible because he doesn't give you enough time, class averages in the 40's. Expects students to be phD's in Mechanics of materials, not to mention 2 design projects and evening exams.
